column2: What were the titles given to the gate keeps of the E-Abzu temple of Enki?

column2: What type of afterlife could Sumerians look forward to?
column3: It was believed that when people died, they would be confined to a gloomy world of Ereshkigal, whose realm was guarded by gateways with various monsters designed to prevent people entering or leaving.

column2: What type of afterlife could Sumerians look forward to?
column3: The dead were buried outside the city walls in graveyards where a small mound covered the corpse, along with offerings to monsters and a small amount of food.
